meanings.definition: A sale of merchandise at reduced prices to get rid of excess inventory.
meanings.sent1: During the closeout, all items are marked down for quick sale.
meanings.sent2: I found a great deal on a jacket during the closeout at the store.
meanings.sent3: At the closeout, even the most expensive items were selling for a bargain.
meanings.sent4: The closeout was like a treasure hunt, with hidden gems waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The closeout was so popular that people lined up early to grab the best deals.

meanings.definition: The final sale of goods at the end of a season or business period.
meanings.sent1: The closeout event marked the end of the summer season at the store.
meanings.sent2: Customers eagerly awaited the closeout to purchase items at discounted prices.
meanings.sent3: The closeout felt like a celebration, with everyone excited about the great deals.
meanings.sent4: As the closeout approached, the shelves started to empty, signaling the end of the season.
meanings.sent5: The closeout was a bittersweet moment, saying goodbye to the old inventory and welcoming the new.

meanings.definition: The act of completing or finalizing a business transaction or deal.
meanings.sent1: The closeout of the contract was a relief after weeks of negotiations.
meanings.sent2: The successful closeout of the deal brought satisfaction to both parties.
meanings.sent3: The closeout meeting was a formal affair, marking the official end of the agreement.
meanings.sent4: With the closeout complete, they could now move on to the next project.
meanings.sent5: The closeout was the last step in the process, ensuring all details were finalized.
